It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist meadows and along streambanks. Epilobium caesiovirens is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with a fibrous root system adapted to wet environments.
